context: This criteria evaluates how effectively the engineer uses the assemblyai-tool package to implement a batch transcription solution. The focus is on correctly utilizing the package's batch command with appropriate concurrency controls, rate limiting, vocabulary boosting, and speaker identification features.

checklist.name: Batch command usage
checklist.description: Uses the 'aait batch' command (or equivalent batch functionality from the assemblyai-tool package) to process multiple audio files from the input directory to the output directory

checklist.name: Upload concurrency
checklist.description: Configures upload concurrency to 3 concurrent uploads using the --upload-concurrency parameter

checklist.name: Processing concurrency
checklist.description: Configures processing concurrency to 8 concurrent jobs using the --processing-concurrency parameter

checklist.name: Ratio-based rate limiting
checklist.description: Implements bandwidth control using --rate-limit-ratio parameter set to 0.6 (60% of initial upload speed)

checklist.name: Custom vocabulary
checklist.description: Provides vocabulary boost for the specified technical terms (Kubernetes, Python, Docker, TypeScript) using the --word-boost parameter with comma-separated values

checklist.name: Boost strength
checklist.description: Sets boost parameter to 'high' strength using the --boost-param parameter

checklist.name: Speaker labels
checklist.description: Enables speaker identification using the --speaker-labels flag or parameter

checklist.name: Output format
checklist.description: Specifies plain text format using the --format parameter set to 'text'

checklist.name: Skip existing files
checklist.description: Configures the script to skip already-transcribed files (either by omitting --force flag, or using package's default skip behavior)
